metadata.title: No Silver Bullet: Essence and Accidents of Software Engineering
metadata.abstract: But, as we look to the horizon of a decade hence, we see no silver bullet. There is no single development, in either technology or in management technique, that by itself promises even one orderof-magnitude improvement in productivity, in reliability, in simplicity. In this article, I shall try to show why, by examining both the nature of the software problem and the properties of the bullets proposed.

grobid.contents:
No Silver Bullet: Essence and Accidents of Software Engineering
April 1987

Frederick P Brooks Jr
No Silver Bullet: Essence and Accidents of Software Engineering

Computer
204April 1987
Promises• Buy versus build -> components ☺ • Requirements refinement and rapid prototyping • Great designers • Anything else 20 years later?
